input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: CEO has a direct effect on director and having visited England. Having visited England has a direct effect on employee. Director has a direct effect on employee. The overall probability of having visited England is 61%. The probability of not having visited England and employee being fired is 12%. The probability of having visited England and employee being fired is 41%. Is the chance of employee being fired smaller when observing having visited England?
